result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan C Conner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: consecutive to 14 CF 20 - Defendant refused probation so sentence is imposed on 5/15/14

miscConds.notes: Not to have any contact with Jessica Beecroft unless DOC and Jessica agree to contact.

Comply with any and all treatment that DOC may recommend and follow thru with all recommendations.  Psychological assessment/evalulation and any follow thru.  To obtain and maintain employment.  Any conditions DOC may impose.  Restitution in 14 CF 20 also on this case payable at $50.00 per month

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Bryan C Conner in court, in custody via phone.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3:52 PM Court calls cases and recites appearances.  Court addressed Mr. Conner - defendant is requesting to return to probation.  Court makes stmt.  Defendant states he didn't remember signing the post-conviction relief forms.  Court continues to address the defendant re: to take the imposed/stayed prison sentence at the time of the original sentence.  Defendant makes stmt.  Court further addressed the defendant.  Atty Frost makes arguement - opposes this request.  Rebuttal by Mr. Conner.
COURT:  motion is denied - has the right to appeal today's decision
Defendant makes further stmt
Court further addressed the defendant
Court of appeals - postconviction relief is denied

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan C Conner in court with attorney Mary A Swan.  Defendant Bryan C Conner in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 21, 14 CF 28 and 13 CM 249.  9:02 AM Court calls cases and appearances.  Atty Swan Page 6 has correction to the PSI.  Atty Frost tendered a restitution document.  Atty Swan requests 30 days.  Court makes stmt Atty Swan has 30 days to review restitution request.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Swan makes arguement.  Defendant addressed the Court. 

COURT:  advised the defendant there is a no contact with Jessica Beecroft it is in place until the Court states it has been lifted.
        13 CM 249:  90 days county jail with huber for work search/work - costs - 85 days credit 
14 CF 21: 9 months county jail with huber for work search/work - costs - submit a DNA surcharge
  14 CF 20:  impose/stay 4 years prison - 2 years in - 2 yrs ES (count 1) - eligible for challenge and sentence abuse program - probation 3 years pmt of restitution to Tony's Riverside - Economart - Dollar General and Transition Homes $1541.11 (Atty Swan will be allowed a hearing) to be paid at $50.00 per month - costs - comply with any and all treatment that DOC may recommend and follow thru with all recommendations made - psychological assessment/evaluation and any follow thru - obtain and maintain employment - no contact with Jessica Beecroft unless probation and Jessica agree to contact - any condtions DOC may impose - DNA surcharge ordered and sample
   14 CF 28:  impose/stay 4 years prison - (ct 1) 2 yrs in and 2 yrs ES - consecutive to 14 CF 20 eligible for challenge and abuse program
Probation 3 years concurrent to 14 CF 20 - same conditions as in 14 CF 20 - costs - DNA surcharge ordered

Defendant, Bryan C Conner appeared with Attorney Mary A Swan.  Attorney Frost  appeared for the State.  Court appears by phone.  Kim Gunderson of the DOC also appears.  Court calls case and appearances. To be heard with 14 CF 20, 14 CF 21, 14 CF 28.
Ms. Swan's motion for furlough to attend Teen Challenge Program
copy of PSI to both Atty's
Sentencing hearing on May 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Atty Swan waived reading and entered plea of not guilty entered by the defendant.   Atty Swan requests bail modification signature bond.  State makes arguement was addressed at the last hearing.  Rebuttal by Atty Swan.  State makes further arguement.  Court bail modification is denied.

Defendant Bryan C Conner in court with attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  Defendant Bryan C Conner in custody.  Thomas Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 13 CM 249, 14 CF 16, 14 CF 20, 14 CF 21 and 14 CF 28.  Atty Swan waived preliminary exam.  Court addressed the defendant re: waiver of prelim.  defendant does not wish to have a prelim.   Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
